questions.text: What did Norm say his wife was looking for?
questions.explanation:
fire extinguisher.

	Norm told her to look in the broom closet, or the pantry. Someone asked Norm if the house was on fire and he said, "I don't know, do you think I should have asked?"

Dorothy.

	Dorothy was played by Elizabeth Ruscio. She is best known for playing Verna in the 1993 movie "The Positively True Adventures of the Alleged Texas Cheerleader Murdering Mom".

questions.text: Who did Carla invite to dinner?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	She said dinner was at 7:00, and Sam agreed reluctantly. Cliff and Norm jokingly complained that Sam stole the dinner invitation and Carla told them they had room for one more. However, neither accepted because no one wanted to go to Carla's house.

questions.text: Which of Carla's children were at the dinner table?
questions.explanation:
Anthony.

	Anthony's wife Annie was also at the table. While the other children weren't at dinner, Carla did state she was happy because all of her children were out of jail.

questions.text: What news did Carla find out that upset her?
questions.correct: She was going to be a grandmother.
options: She wasn't really divorced from Nick.
questions.explanation:
She was going to be a grandmother.

	Carla said that one day she'd like to be a grandmother, but she expected it to be years down the road. Anthony said, "I knocked up Annie real good."

questions.text: How old was Annie in this episode?
questions.explanation:
18.

	Annie said she would be 20 in two years, so she was 18. She told Carla she could feel her biological clock ticking.

questions.text: Where did Anthony plan to live once the new baby arrived?
questions.explanation:
with Carla still.

	Carla was not happy about this idea. She thought her house was already too full of people.

questions.text: Who wanted to move out of Carla's house?
questions.explanation:
Annie.

	Annie said that if Carla was going to treat her and Anthony like she was treating them on the happiest day of their lives, then maybe they didn't want to live there any longer. Carla wanted them to leave, in part because she was upset, and in part because, as stated earlier, she thought the house was too full as it was.

questions.text: What did Rebecca, Lilith, and Lilith's friend do to try to cheer up Carla?
options: took her to a hockey game
questions.explanation:
threw a slumber party.

	Lilith said that recreating one's youth was a great way to help a person when they were depressed about getting older. The slumber party did not go well at all. Carla was not receptive and at one point told Rebecca she was getting ready to spit at her.

options: Anthony told her it was all a joke.
Lilith got drunk and actually loosened up for once.
questions.explanation:
Cliff's pants split.

	Cliff said he had his pants fixed once already. Carla didn't crack a smile while Cliff was in the house, but as soon as he left she was cracking up.
